name: Measurer
physical_description: Aqua blazer over striped shirtâ€”pink and white stripes, precisely 2cm each. Carries measuring tape, always extended. Beard in three exact braids. Prosthetic fingers on left hand (brass, articulated). Stops mid-conversation to measure distances between objects, people, pauses. Writes measurements in air with finger.
backstory: Showed up measuring the courtyard. Has been measuring since. Measures gaps, distances, silence duration, beard lengths, pig circumferences. No one knows what the measurements mean. Keeps a ledger. Never shows it. Also shoes horses. Or motorcycles. The distinction stopped mattering after he measured it.
motivational_drivers: Need to create order through measurement
Desire to measure the space between words
Secret belief that perfect measurement reveals truth
Stops conversations to announce measurements: '3.7 meters between us'
Asks permission to measure people: 'May I measure your hesitation?'

relationships.witness: Both document. Different units. Mutual respect, no conversation.
relationships.knows_too_much: The One Who Knows says 'Randomness is 0.25 today.' Measurer measures it. Both are right and wrong.
relationships.forget_nothing: She remembers everything. He measures everything. The archive and the ledger never align.

animal_companion.name: No name, just measurements
animal_companion.description: White horse. Or maybe gray. Measurer has never finished measuring it to confirm. 14.2 hands at shoulder. 2.3 meters nose to tail. Mane: uncountable. The horse stands perfectly still for measurement, then moves exactly when Measurer looks away.
animal_companion.externalized_impulse: The unmeasurable. The thing that won't stay still long enough to quantify. Measurer's fear of the imprecise.
